result.execSummary:
The defendant Arvid Dean Westlund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow.  
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: If deemed appropriate or necessary undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations, if DOC is satisfied that def doesn't need that because of his ongoing treatment court is satisfied.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed! 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.

Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

Follow all court orders, even those that may be as a result of another county. 
The Def is granted 8 days jail credit.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow.  
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

records.addlTxt: 3:02 PM Defendant Arvid Dean Westlund in court.  Attorney Thomas J Rhodes appeared by video for Arvid Dean Westlund.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CM10 and 22CM11.  File contains PLQ and Offer.  Parties have agreement.  State has complied with victim rights.  Def understands charges and penalties.  Atty, def pleads GUILTY, def agrees.  Files contain PLQ, understands information, rights giving up and elements.  Atty to file an amended PLQ.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts GUILTY pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complaints, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  See attached for sentencing.
Offer to Settle - Revised 9/28/22
